TextView.android:text: Attempting to wholly understand this movement can truly be overwhelming. There is so much to learn and so much information readily available that it can often be confusing to know how to actually make a difference. If you are here reading and looking for ways to help out, you have already taken the first step of helping out. Being educated on this matter is highly important before you can go out and make change. Now that you have a decent understanding of what this movement is about, there are a few other steps you can take that would really help make an impact on the world.

The four key things that any person can do to help is to donate, sign petitions, show up to protests, and vote if you are old enough to. If you are able to do any or all of these things, it will help make a truly lasting change in our country. It is time we see real change for all of these movements and down below is how you can do your part. It is also important to just reach out and check in on friends and family. Share your resources and have difficult conversations with the more close-minded people of our societies. Be an ally in any way possible because staying silent only adds to the oppressions that have already been going on for much too long.

Donating is a crucial part of every movement. Notable organizations already fully commit to this cause and do incredible work and even the smallest donation can help advance significant changes in our society. Aside from donating money, you can also donate your time to these organizations who are always looking for volunteers to help out.
142 Ways to Donate to help BLM!
Here are a few to get started on. It just takes a few clicks to help push forward the change!

Protests have been extremely important in understanding the issues this country faces. The people's voice matters and if enough choose to speak up and demand a change, there will be reform. Especially in the younger generation, there are much louder voices that are pressuring officials to take action. Four out of five people under the age of thirty support BLM, and this generation is the one leading these protests. Go to these protests and demonstrate to the black community that we believe their suffering must come to an end. Stand in solidarity with them and prove to our government that no one will put up with the blatant disrespect black people face in this country everyday.

There has been a lot of controversy surrounding the protests in 2020 centered around this movement. While, globally, the majority of these protests have been peaceful, a few have escalated and gotten slightly violent. Some people shame the very few protestors who have gotten violent, but that is because they do not understand the suppression these people protesting have felt that, in turn, makes them feel the need to retaliate in an aggressive manner. Unless you are a black person, you can not even begin to fathom what it must feel like to exist as a black person in this country and the hundreds of years of oppression their people have faced. Others often point their fingers at looting that has taken place across the country. However, people must note that these heinous acts are not associated with the Black Lives Matter protests, in any way, shape, or form. The looters are simply taking advantage of a tense and unpredictable situation and using this unsteady political climate to get away with crime.

More than 40% of registered black voters are unable to vote due to various obstacles such as either lacking means of transportation or lacking time off of work, and also through being discouraged to vote due to their minority status in most communities. Because of the voter suppression many black people face, we as the allies have the power to help make a difference by exhibiting our undisturbed privilege to vote. You have the power to help make the difference and create a safer world for black people and everyone else. So register now and vote in the 2020 primaries and elections and every year after that, because the discrimination and hate must come to an end.

The power to vote is not something that should be taken lightly. It gives people more power than he or she realizes to help create real change. Voting for bills and local community leaders is a great way to support the black community. Vote for officials who are supportive of the community and are willing to pass laws to create equal rights for them. Vote for bills that actively try to stop discrimination, in any way, against these individuals.
